name: Wallace and Gromit | 15 Question Movie Multiple Choice Quiz

questions.explanation:
They don't say.

	He's just Wallace.

questions.text: What street do Wallace and Gromit live on?
Who is the villain in 'The Wrong Trousers'?
questions.explanation:
Feathers McGraw.

	Preston is the villian in 'A Close Shave.'

questions.text: What is the headline on the newspaper that Gromit reads at the cafe?
questions.correct: Dog Reads Newspaper & Dog Reads Paper
questions.explanation:
Dog Reads Newspaper & Dog Reads Paper.

	This is one of the funniest parts in the movie.

questions.text: 'Everyone knows the moon is made of ______!'
questions.explanation:
Cheese.

	From 'A Grand Day Out', as Wallace and Gromit plan their vacation.

questions.text: In 'A Close Shave,' what machine goes haywire?
questions.explanation:
The porridge maker.

	'I think I'll make my own porridge...'

questions.text: Why did the above machine go haywire?
options: It had fallen on the floor
There was no porrige in it
questions.explanation:
The cord was chewed through.

	Sean chewed up the cord.

questions.text: Where does the villain in 'The Wrong Trousers' go at the end?
Who does the voice of Wallace?
questions.explanation:
Peter Sallis.

	Wallace is the only speaking character in 'A Grand Day Out' and 'The Wrong Trousers.'

questions.text: Whom do Wallace and Gromit meet on the moon?
questions.explanation:
A robot.

	The robot gives them a parking ticket.

questions.text: Who is the only character, besides Wallace, who has a speaking part?
questions.explanation:
Wendolene.

	She owns the wool shop.

questions.text: How did Wallace's relationship with the above character end?
questions.correct: He found out she didn't like cheese
options: She found out that he was an inventor
questions.explanation:
He found out she didn't like cheese.

	'Not even Wenslydale?'

questions.text: Gromit was framed for sheep rustling. True or False?
questions.explanation:
True & T.

	He stuck his head in a hole in a wall and his picture was {taken;} the hole was located where the head would be on a painting of a man holding a butcher's knife and a sheep.

questions.text: The female character's father was an inventor. True or False?
questions.explanation:
True & T.

	'Father would have loved to meet you...'

questions.text: The brains behind the sheep rustling operation also made dog food. What was this dog food called?
questions.explanation:
Preston's Dog Food.

	Guess what was in the dog food?
